# A 53-year-old man with chronic HCV infection for the past 2 years
# He is on IFN (100 mg/week) plus RBV (400 mg/day) combination therapy for the past 9 months
# Direct antiviral drugs were added to his treatment 6 months ago
# His medical record shows previous positive HCV RNA tests as well as positive enzyme immunoassay for anti-HCV-antibodies
# The recent biopsy was negative for hepatocellular carcinoma and was only remarkable for chronic inflammation compatible with a chronic viral hepatitis

Based on the information provided, the patient is eligible for the clinical trial.

Here is the breakdown of the eligibility criteria:

Inclusion Criteria:

* Chronic HCV infection (met)
* Genotype 1 HCV infection (met)
* Currently receiving or have received prior therapy with interferon (not met)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who did not respond or relapsed following therapy with interferon (not met)

The patient is eligible for the clinical trial because they are currently receiving combination therapy with IFN and RBV, and direct antiviral drugs were added to their treatment 6 months ago. The patient's recent biopsy was negative for hepatocellular carcinoma, and the only remarkable finding was chronic inflammation compatible with a chronic viral hepatitis.
